type1.text: Did you ask between 3-5 clarification questions at the start of the interview?
Did all your clarification questions have a strategic aspect related to assessing severity/scope of the problem?
Did you explicitly state at least one assumption made during the interview?
Were you able to list at least 3 user needs/motivations for the product?
Did you link any user motivation to the company's mission?
Did you mention at least 3 industry trends?
Did you identify at least 3 meaningful vectors/considerations for user segmentation?
Were you able to list at least 3 major pain points/opportunities for each user segment?
Did you propose a specific methodology/framework to prioritise the identified pain points?
Did your proposed solution directly address the core prioritised pain point?

type2.text: How well did you identify industry trends and their potential impact?
options: Did not mention any industry trends
Mentioned 1-2 generic trends not specific to the product space
Mentioned 3-4 relevant trends but did not discuss their impact
Discussed 3-4 relevant trends and their high-level impact
Provided insightful analysis of multiple trends and their nuanced impact on users, business, competition

type2.text: How effectively did you demonstrate understanding of the competitive landscape?
options: Did not discuss any competitors
Named 1-2 competitors but did not analyze them
Analyzed 3-4 competitors at a surface level
Provided good analysis of 3-4 key competitors and their differentiation
Provided nuanced analysis of multiple competitors, their strengths/weaknesses, and what it takes to succeed

type2.text: How well did you empathize with user pain points across different segments?
options: Did not identify any user pain points
Listed 1-2 generic pain points lacking user perspective
Listed 3-4 relevant pain points but from a product/business view
Discussed 3-4 pain points from the user's perspective for each segment
Demonstrated deep empathy by vividly capturing user frustrations for multiple segments

type2.text: How reasonable and feasible were the assumptions you stated?
options: Did not explicitly state any assumptions
Stated some invalid or far-fetched assumptions
Stated reasonable but very generic assumptions
Stated specific, realistic assumptions relevant to the product space
Stated nuanced, insightful assumptions showing deep domain understanding

type2.text: How well did you tie your solution to the company's mission and principles?
options: Did not mention the company's mission
Mentioned the mission statement verbatim but did not tie it back
Made a surface-level connection between the solution and mission
Linked the solution's impact to the key aspects of the mission
Proposed a solution firmly grounded in the company's core mission and principles
